headline.print_headline: Man Escapes After Arrest; Officers Draw Bratton’s Ire
headline.main: Bratton Criticizes Police Officers Who Lost Custody of Man After Arrest

snippet: Commissioner William J. Bratton called the officers involved “an embarrassment” after the man escaped, the fifth time since June that police have lost someone in custody.
abstract: New York City Police Commissioner William J Bratton criticizes officers who allowed Gerald Brooks to escape from police custody; Brooks is fifth person to escape from custody in city since June.
lead_paragraph: Commissioner William J. Bratton called the officers involved “an embarrassment” after the man escaped, the fifth time since June that police have lost someone in custody.
